summary: This document is the curriculum vitae of Dr. Park Dietz, a forensic psychiatrist and expert witness. It details his extensive education, professional appointments, awards, research, and notable case consultations, including high-profile criminal cases. It appears to be an exhibit submitted in a legal proceeding, likely to establish his credentials. This document is a detailed curriculum vitae for Park Dietz, M.D., M.P.H., Ph.D., listing his extensive work as a forensic psychiatry consultant for numerous high-profile criminal cases from 1999 to 2021, as well as his expert testimony in trials and depositions from 1990 onward. It establishes his role as a frequent expert witness for both prosecution and defense in major violent crimes. This document is a curriculum vitae or professional resume for Park Dietz, M.D., M.P.H., Ph.D., detailing his extensive testimony history in numerous legal cases across the United States and Canada, as well as his extensive list of publications, books, and professional contributions. It appears to be part of a larger document set, possibly submitted as evidence or background in a legal proceeding. This document is a bibliography and list of presentations for Park Dietz, M.D., M.P.H., Ph.D., a forensic psychiatrist. It details his extensive publications and speaking engagements on topics including sexual violence, homicide, threat assessment, workplace violence, and forensic psychiatry. The document appears to be part of a professional resume or CV. This document is a detailed curriculum vitae for Park Dietz, M.D., M.P.H., Ph.D., listing his extensive teaching experience, professional affiliations, and workplace violence prevention training courses he has designed and taught for numerous corporations and organizations. It appears to be part of a professional background file, likely submitted in a legal or consulting context. This document appears to be a detailed curriculum vitae or professional biography for Park Dietz, M.D., M.P.H., Ph.D., listing his extensive speaking engagements, seminars, and media appearances from 2006 to 2021. It details his work as a consultant on workplace violence prevention for major corporations and his role as a technical advisor for television series and documentaries, including those covering serial killers.

persons.name: Park Dietz
persons.context: The subject of the document, listing his professional speaking engagements, corporate consultations, and media work as a technical advisor and on-camera expert, particularly on topics of workplace violence and criminal psychology.

persons.name: Louis Freeh
persons.context: Cited as having given Dr. Dietz a citation for 'Exceptional Service in the Public Interest' in 1993.

persons.name: John W. Hinckley, Jr.
persons.context: Subject of the case U.S. v. John W. Hinckley, Jr. (attempted assassination of President Reagan) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the U.S. Attorney's Office in 1981-1982.

persons.name: Robert Chambers
persons.context: Subject of 'the Preppy Murder Case' (People v. Robert Chambers) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the New York District Attorney in 1987-1988.

persons.name: Al Sharpton
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the Tawana Brawley grand jury investigation where he accused white law enforcement officials of kidnapping and rape; Dr. Dietz consulted for the NY Attorney General's office on this matter in 1988.

persons.name: Arthur Shawcross
persons.context: Subject of People v. Arthur Shawcross (serial murders of prostitutes) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the Monroe County, NY District Attorney in 1990.

persons.name: Robert Vance
persons.context: A U.S. Circuit Court Judge killed by a mail bomb in the VANPAC case (U.S. v. Walter Leroy Moody, Jr.), for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the U.S. Department of Justice in 1990-1991.

persons.name: Robert Bardo
persons.context: Subject of People v. Robert Bardo (murder of actress Rebecca Schaefer) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the Los Angeles County Public Defender in 1991.

persons.name: Elizabeth Broderick
persons.context: Subject of People v. Elizabeth Broderick (murder of ex-husband and his new wife) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the San Diego County District Attorney in 1991.

persons.name: William George Bonin
persons.context: Subject of William George Bonin v. Vasquez (federal habeas petition of 'the Freeway Killer') for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the California Department of Justice in 1991-1992.

persons.name: Jeffrey L. Dahmer
persons.context: Subject of State v. Jeffrey L. Dahmer (serial murders of men) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the Milwaukee County, Wisconsin District Attorney in 1991-1992.

persons.name: Charles Ng
persons.context: Subject of People v. Charles Ng (serial murders with Leonard Lake) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the California Attorney General's office in 1992-1999.

persons.name: Joel Rifkin
persons.context: Subject of People v. Joel Rifkin (serial murders of prostitutes) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the Nassau and Suffolk County, NY District Attorneys in 1993-1995.

persons.name: Colin Ferguson
persons.context: Subject of People v. Colin Ferguson (mass murder on the Long Island Railroad) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the Nassau County, NY District Attorney in 1994-1995.

persons.name: Susan Smith
persons.context: Subject of People v. Susan Smith (mother who drowned her two children) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the Solicitor for the 16th Circuit, SC in 1994-1995.

persons.name: Richard Allen Davis
persons.context: Subject of People v. Richard Allen Davis (abduction and murder of Polly Klaas) for which Dr. Dietz consulted for the Sonoma County, CA District Attorney in 1994-1996.

persons.context: Subject of a Biography documentary episode in 1995 titled "Ted Bundy: The Mind of a Killer," which is listed in Park Dietz's filmography.

connections.description: Louis Freeh, as FBI Director, cited Dietz for 'Exceptional Service in the Public Interest' in 1993.
Dietz consulted on a grand jury investigation into allegations made by Rev. Al Sharpton in the Tawana Brawley matter.
Dietz served as a consultant to the prosecution in Kinkel's school shooting case.
Dietz served as a consultant to the prosecution and testified as an expert witness in Yates's trials for drowning her children.
Dietz served as a consultant to the defense for the Kalpoe brothers in their defamation lawsuit related to the Natalee Holloway case.
Dietz served as a consultant to the defense for the Kalpoe brothers in their defamation lawsuit related to the Natalee Holloway case.
Dietz was a consultant for the defense, which included Dr. Phil, in the Kalpoe brothers' defamation lawsuit.
Dietz consulted for the prosecution in a sadomasochistic sex trafficking case involving Bagley.
Dietz consulted for the defense in the prosecution of Silk Road founder Ross Ulbricht.
Park Dietz testified as an expert witness at the trial where Samuel Dieteman was a defendant.
Park Dietz testified as an expert witness at the trial where Dale Hausner was a defendant.
Park Dietz testified as an expert witness at the trial where Lisa Montgomery was a defendant.
Park Dietz was deposed as an expert in a civil case where Phillip McGraw (Dr. Phil) was a defendant.
Listed as co-plaintiffs in a civil lawsuit against Phillip McGraw and others.
Listed as co-defendants in a Canadian criminal case.
Listed as co-defendants in a federal criminal case.
Co-authored research publications and presented together at professional conferences.
Co-presented courses and research on psychological crime scene analysis, sexual offenders, and serial homicide.
Co-presented research on sexual sadism, masochism, and criminal profiling, indicating a collaborative relationship in forensic research.
Dietz conducted the forensic psychiatric evaluation of Hinckley and presented on the case at multiple conferences.
Co-organized a symposium at the FBI Academy and co-taught professional courses on behavioral crime investigation.
Co-organized an academic clerkship at Harvard Medical School.
Co-taught a medical sociology course at Johns Hopkins University.
Collaborated on a webinar for Macy's Asset Protection Department on workplace violence prevention in November 2016.

events.title: FBI Citation for Service
events.description: Park Dietz received a citation for 'Exceptional Service in the Public Interest' from FBI Director Louis Freeh.

events.title: Consultation on Hinckley Case
events.description: Park Dietz consulted for the U.S. Attorney's Office in the case of U.S. v. John W. Hinckley, Jr., the attempted assassination of President Reagan.

events.title: Consultation on Tawana Brawley Investigation
events.description: Park Dietz consulted for the NY Attorney General's office in the grand jury investigation into allegations arising from the Tawana Brawley matter, which involved accusations by Rev. Al Sharpton.

events.title: Consultation on VANPAC Mail Bomb Case
events.description: Park Dietz consulted for the U.S. Department of Justice in U.S. v. Walter Leroy Moody, Jr., the case involving mail bombs that killed Judge Robert Vance and others.

events.title: Consultation on O.J. Simpson Civil Case
events.description: Park Dietz consulted for the plaintiffs in the civil suit Goldman v. O.J. Simpson for the murders of Ronald Goldman and Nicole Brown Simpson.

events.title: Consultation on Unabom Case
events.description: Park Dietz consulted for the U.S. Department of Justice in U.S. v. Theodore Kaczynski, the Unabom case.

events.title: Columbine High School Massacre
events.description: Mass murder and suicides by Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold at Columbine High School.

events.title: Boston Marathon Bombing
events.description: Mass murder bombing at the Boston Marathon.

events.title: Charleston Church Shooting
events.description: Mass murder at the African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C.

events.title: Dietz Expert Testimony Deposition
events.description: Park Dietz testified at a deposition in Joanne Goldman v. Sol I. and Gladys L. Goldman, marking the start of his listed expert testimony.

events.title: O.J. Simpson Civil Case Testimony
events.description: Park Dietz testified at a deposition and hearing in the Goldman v. O.J. Simpson civil case.

events.title: Jeffrey Dahmer Trial Testimony
events.description: Park Dietz testified at the trial of serial killer Jeffrey L. Dahmer.

events.title: Dietz Testimony in O'Donnabhain v. Commissioner
events.description: Park Dietz testified at trial in Boston, MA.

events.title: Dietz Testimony in AZ v. Dieteman and Hausner
events.description: Park Dietz testified at trial in Phoenix, AZ, for defendants Samuel Dieteman and Dale Hausner.

events.title: Dietz Testimony in US v. Lisa Montgomery
events.description: Park Dietz testified at trial in Kansas City, MO, for defendant Lisa Montgomery.

events.title: Dietz Telephonic Testimony in US v. Eric Bailey
events.description: Park Dietz testified telephonically at a competency hearing in Washington, DC, for defendant Eric Bailey.

events.title: Dietz Deposition in Kalpoe v. McGraw
events.description: Park Dietz was deposed in a civil case where Deepak and Satish Kalpoe sued Phillip McGraw and CBS.

events.title: Dietz Addresses Court in US v. David Brooks
events.description: Park Dietz addressed the court at the sentencing of defendant David Brooks in Central Islip, NY.

events.title: APHA Presentation on Drowning
events.description: Park Dietz and Baker SP presented 'Drowning: Etiologic Factors and Preventive Approaches' at the American Public Health Association in San Francisco.

events.title: Presentation on Battery in Maximum Security Hospital
events.description: Park Dietz and Rada RT presented 'Battery Incidents and Batterers in a Maximum Security Hospital' at the Fifth International Congress of Law and Psychiatry in Banff, Canada.

events.title: FBI Symposium on Sexual Assault Evidence
events.description: Park Dietz presented 'Sex Offender Profiling by the FBI: A Preliminary Conceptual Model' at the Forensic Science Symposium at the FBI Academy in Quantico, Virginia.

events.title: World Conference on Police Psychology
events.description: Park Dietz and Hazelwood RR presented on 'Research Collaboration Between Law Enforcement and Mental Health: The Study of Masochism and Sadism' at the FBI Academy.

events.title: Presentation on Tawana Brawley Case
events.description: Poklemba, Ryan, Dietz PE, and Baden MM presented 'Forensic Evidence in the Tawana Brawley Case' at the American Academy of Forensic Sciences.

events.title: FBI Symposium on Jeffery Dahmer Case
events.description: Park Dietz and Sucik R presented 'The Jeffery Dahmer Case' at the International Homicide Symposium at the FBI Academy.

events.title: AAPL Presidential Address
events.description: Park Dietz delivered the Presidential Address, 'The Quest for Excellence in Forensic Psychiatry,' at the American Academy of Psychiatry and the Law in Seattle.

events.title: Symposium at FBI Academy
events.description: Park Dietz, Robert K. Ressler, and Richard Ratner organized a symposium at the National Center for the Analysis of Violent Crime, held at the FBI Academy in Quantico, VA.

events.title: Course on Behavioral Crime Investigation
events.description: Park Dietz and Robert K. Ressler taught a course on 'Behavioral Aspects of Crime Investigation for Criminal and Civil Litigation' at the American Academy of Forensic Sciences in San Antonio, TX.

events.title: Course at Atlanta Federal Penitentiary
events.description: Park Dietz taught a course on 'Forensic Evaluation and Expert Testimony in Criminal Cases' for the U.S. Bureau of Prisons at the Atlanta Federal Penitentiary.

events.title: Course for Maricopa County DA
events.description: Park Dietz taught a course on 'The Use of Forensic Mental Health Experts in the Investigation and Prosecution of Sex Crimes and Violent Crimes' for the Maricopa County District Attorney's Office and Arizona law enforcement.

locations: Maricopa County District Attorney's Office, Phoenix, AZ
keyFacts: Park Dietz is a highly credentialed forensic psychiatrist with decades of experience as an expert witness and consultant to law enforcement and legal agencies.

His CV lists consultation on numerous infamous criminal cases, including those of John Hinckley Jr., Jeffrey Dahmer, the Menendez brothers, O.J. Simpson (civil), Theodore Kaczynski (Unabom), and the Unabom case.
He has held long-term consulting roles with the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit and the New York State Police's Forensic Sciences Unit.
He served as a Commissioner on the U.S. Attorney General's Commission on Pornography in 1985-1986.
The document is dated July 15, 2021, suggesting it is a recent submission of his qualifications, likely for a court proceeding.
Park Dietz has served as a forensic psychiatry consultant in hundreds of the most high-profile violent crime cases in the United States from 1999 to 2021.
His consulting work includes cases for both prosecution and defense, spanning school shootings, serial murders, terrorism, sex trafficking, and white-collar crime.
The CV lists his expert testimony in trials and depositions for cases dating back to 1990, including those of O.J. Simpson, Jeffrey Dahmer, and the Menendez brothers.
Dietz consulted on the psychological autopsy project for the 1999 Columbine High School massacre.
